election_record.label: New York 1819 State Senate, Southern District

sub_unit.name: Beekman
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 1 vote as James Tallmadge.

sub_unit.name: Fishkill
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 3 votes as James Tallmadge.

sub_unit.name: North East
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 3 votes as James Tallmadge.

sub_unit.name: Pawlings
sub_unit.note: Philip J. Schuyler received 1 vote as Philip Schuyler.
Peter R. Livingston received 1 vote as Peter Livingston.

sub_unit.name: Poughkeepsie
sub_unit.note: Philip J. Schuyler received 1 vote as Philip Schuyler.

sub_unit.name: Rhinebeck
sub_unit.note: Philip J. Schuyler received 4 votes as Philip Schuyler and 1 vote as Philip P. Schuyler.
James Tallmadge, Jr. received 1 vote as James Tallmadge.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 1 vote as James Tallmadge.

sub_unit.name: Kings
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 5 votes as James Tallmadge.
The Long Island Star, May 5, lists 186 votes for James Tallmadge and 184 votes for Pierre Van Cortlandt in Kings County, though the town totals add up to 185 and 183.

sub_unit.name: New York
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 283 votes as James Tallmadge.

The Albany Argus (Albany, NY), May 7; the Commercial Advertiser, May 3; the Columbian, May 8; the National Advocate, May 3; and The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 4, report 805 votes for Philip J. Schuyler and 588 for Pierre Van Cortlandt in New York City.
The Long Island Star, May 5, reports 1499 votes for John Townsend, 426 for James Tallmadge, Jr., 583 for Pierre Van Cortlandt, and 805 for Philip J. Schuyler in New York City.

sub_unit.name: Three
sub_unit.note: The Columbian May 8, and The National Advocate, May 3, list Philip J. Schuyler with 180 votes in Ward 3, which was apparently a misreading of the original written total of "one hundred and eighteen."

sub_unit.name: Putnam
sub_unit.note: The National Advocate, May 6, reports 403 votes for John Townsend in Putnam county.

sub_unit.name: Carmel
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 1 vote as James Tallmadge.

sub_unit.name: Kent
sub_unit.note: The town of Frederick changed its name to Kent in 1817. Some newspapers in 1819 still referred to the town as Frederick.

sub_unit.name: Southeast
sub_unit.note: One vote for Philip J. Schuyler has been credited to Philip S. Schuyler in Putnam County, town of Southeast. The official canvass of votes gives this vote for "Peter J. Schuyler," but it is listed as Philip J. Schuyler in the original election returns and in the Columbian June 10, 1819; it was apparently transcribed incorrectly in the official canvass.

sub_unit.name: Queens
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 19 votes as James Tallmadge.
The Long Island Star, May 5, reports 428 votes for Philip J. Schuyler in Queens County.

sub_unit.name: Flushing
sub_unit.note: The National Advocate, May 1, reports 19 votes for Pierre Van Cortlandt in Flushing.

sub_unit.name: North Hempstead
sub_unit.note: The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 1, reports 48 votes for James Morris in North Hempstead.

sub_unit.name: Richmond
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 37 votes as James Tallmadge.

sub_unit.name: Suffolk
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY), May 14, reports 1097 votes for Peter R. Livingston in Suffolk County.

sub_unit.name: Islip
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 9 votes as James Tallmadge.

sub_unit.name: Riverhead
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 1 vote as James Tallmadge.

sub_unit.name: Southold
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 1 vote as James Tallmadge.

sub_unit.name: Westchester
sub_unit.note: James Tallmadge, Jr. received 20 votes as James Tallmage and 8 votes as James Tallmadge.
Peter R. Livingston received 1 vote as Peter Livingston.

The Columbian, May 12 and 14, and the Westchester Herald (Mount Pleasant, NY), May 18, report 853 votes for John Townsend, 820 for Peter Livingston, 334 for James Tallmadge, 430 for Philip J. Schuyler, 360 for Pierre Van Cortlandt, and 482 for James Morris in Westchester county.
The National Advocate, May 11, reports 430 votes for Philip J. Schuyler, 330 for Pierre Van Cortlandt, and 334 for James Tallmadge in Westchester county.

sub_unit.name: Cortlandt
sub_unit.note: The National Advocate, May 6 and 7, report 25 votes for Philip J. Schuyler in Cortlandt.

sub_unit.name: Mount Pleasant
sub_unit.note: The National Advocate, May 6 and 7, report 65 votes for John Townsend in Mount Pleasant.

sub_unit.name: North Salem
sub_unit.note: "In North Salem .... Livingston and Townsend's majority for Senators, about 70." Westchester Herald (Mount Pleasant, NY). May 4, 1819.

sub_unit.name: Somers
sub_unit.note: The National Advocate, May 6 and 7, report 37 votes for Peter R. Livingston and 85 votes for Philip J. Schuyler in Somers.

sub_unit.name: Yorktown
sub_unit.note: The National Advocate, May 6 and 7, report 14 votes for James Tallmadge and 13 votes for Pierre Van Cortlandt in Yorktown.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Dutchess County Historian, Poughkeepsie.
Orange County Patriot; or, the Spirit of Seventy-Six (Goshen, NY). April 13, 1819.
The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY). May 1, 1819.
The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY). May 4, 1819.
The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY). May 4, 1819.
National Advocate (For the Country) (New York, NY). May 7, 1819.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). May 8, 1819.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). May 12, 1819.
The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY). May 14, 1819.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). June 10, 1819.
